The number of ceasefire violations registered by the Special Monitoring Mission (SMM) in Donetsk region remained high. The use of mortar fire hit a new high with around 970 explosions recorded between 11-17 April. Fighting concentrated around three hotspots: the area between Avdiivka and Yasynuvata, and also Donetsk airport; the northern and western outskirts of Horlivka; and the area south and south-east of Svitlodarsk.

On 15 April in Luhansk region the SMM recorded an increase in ceasefire violations with more than 100 explosions around Stanytsia Luhanska.

The SMM notes more and more weapons absent from the sites they were previously withdrawn to. Monitors consistently see weapons in use and in violation of respective withdrawal lines - often positioned inside populated areas - on both sides of the contact line.

The SMM’s freedom of movement is increasingly restricted.

Recently the SMM monitors faced serious security incidents: an SMM vehicle was hit by a bullet near Snizhne on 7 April while hours later monitors were threatened at gunpoint near Smile (see: www.osce.org/ukraine-smm/231901). On 9 April an SMM patrol came under fire in Zhovanka (see: www.osce.org/ukraine-smm/232326).

On 15 April the OSCE SMM Chief Monitor Ertugrul Apakan expressed his dismay at the increase in fighting in the east of the country. Read more at: www.osce.org/ukraine-smm/233936

On 16 April two additional SMM cameras – one in government-controlled Avdiivka and another at the “DPR”-controlled Oktiabr mine – were installed and now operate 24/7.
